ru.jango.j0widget.imagebrowser

Class Zoomer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.jango.j0widget.imagebrowser.Zoomer

  • public class Zoomer
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple class that animates double-touch zoom gestures. Functionally similar to a Scroller.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Zoomer() 
      Zoomer(int animationDurationMillis) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abortAnimation()
      Aborts the animation, setting the current zoom value to the ending value.
      boolean computeZoom()
      Computes the current zoom level, returning true if the zoom is still active and false if the zoom has finished.
      void forceFinished(boolean finished)
      Forces the zoom finished state to the given value.
      int getAnimationDurationMillis()
      Returns the duration of zoom animation in milliseconds
      android.graphics.Rect getCurrentRect()
      Returns source rectangle with applied current zoom level
      float getCurrZoom()
      Returns the current zoom level.
      android.graphics.Point getFocalPoint()
      Returns focal point of the current zoom
      android.graphics.Rect getSourceRect()
      Returns initial rectangle for zooming
      void setAnimationDurationMillis(int animationDurationMillis)
      Sets the duration of zooming
      void startZoom(android.graphics.Rect sourceRect, android.graphics.Point focalPoint, float endZoom)
      Starts a zoom from 1.0 to (1.0 + endZoom).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Zoomer

        public Zoomer()

      • Zoomer

        public Zoomer(int animationDurationMillis)

    • Method Detail

      • forceFinished

        public void forceFinished(boolean finished)
        Forces the zoom finished state to the given value. Unlike abortAnimation(), the current zoom value isn't set to the ending value.
        See Also:
        Scroller.forceFinished(boolean)

      • abortAnimation

        public void abortAnimation()
        Aborts the animation, setting the current zoom value to the ending value.
        See Also:
        Scroller.abortAnimation()

      • startZoom

        public void startZoom(android.graphics.Rect sourceRect,
             android.graphics.Point focalPoint,
             float endZoom)
        Starts a zoom from 1.0 to (1.0 + endZoom). That is, to zoom from 100% to 125%, endZoom should be 0.25f.
        See Also:
        Scroller.startScroll(int, int, int, int)

      • computeZoom

        public boolean computeZoom()
        Computes the current zoom level, returning true if the zoom is still active and false if the zoom has finished.
        See Also:
        Scroller.computeScrollOffset()

      • getCurrZoom

        public float getCurrZoom()
        Returns the current zoom level.
        See Also:
        Scroller.getCurrX()

      • getSourceRect

        public android.graphics.Rect getSourceRect()
        Returns initial rectangle for zooming
        See Also:
        startZoom(Rect, Point, float)

      • getCurrentRect

        public android.graphics.Rect getCurrentRect()
        Returns source rectangle with applied current zoom level

      • getFocalPoint

        public android.graphics.Point getFocalPoint()
        Returns focal point of the current zoom

      • setAnimationDurationMillis

        public void setAnimationDurationMillis(int animationDurationMillis)
        Sets the duration of zooming
        Parameters:
        animationDurationMillis - duration in milliseconds

      • getAnimationDurationMillis

        public int getAnimationDurationMillis()
        Returns the duration of zoom animation in milliseconds
